docs.title: Azure CAF Terraform – DeepWiki
docs.text:
This site provides a navigable documentation experience for the CAF Terraform framework:

  • Category-based catalog of modules with Mermaid dependency diagrams
  • Root-level (aggregator) pages showing how the root ties modules together
  • Links to API reference pages per module when available

Use the left navigation to browse categories and pages. Diagrams are rendered with Mermaid.

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text: Understanding the terraform-azurerm-caf framework architecture and design patterns

docs.title: 🏗️ Framework Architecture
docs.text: The terraform-azurerm-caf framework is built on a 3-layer architecture that separates concerns and enables scalability from simple deployments to complex enterprise environments.

docs.title: 3-Layer Design Pattern
docs.text:
┌───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    LAYER 1: ROOT/AGGREGATORS                      │
│                                                                   │
│  Purpose: Orchestrate multiple services together                 │
│  Location: /*.tf (root directory)                                │
│  Pattern: Module calls with for_each loops                       │
│                                                                   │
│  Files:                                                           │
│  - networking_virtual_networks.tf                                │
│  - compute_virtual_machines.tf                                   │
│  - cognitive_services_cognitive_accounts.tf                      │
│  - grafana.tf                                                    │
│                                                                   │
│  Responsibilities:                                               │
│  - Call modules from Layer 2                                     │
│  - Pass dependencies through remote_objects                      │
│  - Expose outputs for cross-module references                   │
│  - Manage variables and locals                                   │
└───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                              ↓
┌───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    LAYER 2: MODULES                               │
│                                                                   │
│  Purpose: Implement Azure resources with CAF patterns            │
│  Location: /modules/category/service_name/                       │
│  Pattern: Resource definitions with standard structure           │
│                                                                   │
│  Structure:                                                       │
│  modules/cognitive_services/cognitive_services_account/          │
│  ├── providers.tf              # Provider requirements           │
│  ├── variables.tf              # Standard variables              │
│  ├── outputs.tf                # Resource outputs                │
│  ├── locals.tf                 # Common transformations          │
│  ├── azurecaf_name.tf          # CAF naming                      │
│  ├── cognitive_services_account.tf  # Main resource             │
│  ├── diagnostics.tf            # Diagnostics integration         │
│  └── private_endpoints.tf     # Private endpoint integration     │
│                                                                   │
│  Responsibilities:                                               │
│  - Define Azure resources                                        │
│  - Implement CAF naming conventions                              │
│  - Integrate diagnostics and private endpoints                  │
│  - Resolve dependencies via remote_objects                       │
│  - Provide outputs for other modules                             │
└───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                              ↓
┌───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    LAYER 3: EXAMPLES                              │
│                                                                   │
│  Purpose: Demonstrate usage and serve as automated tests         │
│  Location: /examples/category/service_name/                      │
│  Pattern: Numbered directories by complexity                     │
│                                                                   │
│  Structure:                                                       │
│  examples/cognitive_services/cognitive_services_account/         │
│  ├── 100-simple-cognitive-account/                               │
│  │   └── configuration.tfvars    # Basic configuration           │
│  ├── 200-cognitive-private-endpoint/                             │
│  │   └── configuration.tfvars    # With networking               │
│  └── 300-cognitive-advanced/                                     │
│      └── configuration.tfvars    # All features                  │
│                                                                   │
│  Responsibilities:                                               │
│  - Provide working configurations                                │
│  - Demonstrate module features                                   │
│  - Serve as automated tests (CI/CD)                              │
│  - Document usage patterns                                       │
└───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The root layer serves as the orchestration layer that: - Calls modules for each Azure service - Manages cross-module dependencies - Exposes combined outputs - Handles variables and configuration

docs.title: File Structure
docs.text:
terraform-azurerm-caf/
├── networking_virtual_networks.tf    # Aggregator for VNets
├── compute_aks_clusters.tf          # Aggregator for AKS
├── cognitive_services_cognitive_accounts.tf  # Aggregator for Cognitive Services
├── grafana.tf                        # Aggregator for Grafana
├── variables.tf                      # All module variables
├── outputs.tf                        # All module outputs
├── locals.tf                         # Variable transformations
├── locals.combined_objects.tf       # Merged remote objects
├── module.tf                         # Module declarations
└── providers.tf                      # Provider configuration

docs.title: Aggregator Pattern
docs.text:
Every aggregator file follows this pattern:

# File: cognitive_services_cognitive_accounts.tf

# Call the module with for_each loop
module "cognitive_services_account" {
  source   = "./modules/cognitive_services/cognitive_services_account"
  for_each = local.cognitive_services.cognitive_services_account

  # Standard variables
  global_settings     = local.global_settings
  client_config       = local.client_config
  location            = try(each.value.location, null)
  base_tags           = local.global_settings.inherit_tags
  resource_group      = local.combined_objects_resource_groups[...][...]
  resource_group_name = local.combined_objects_resource_groups[...][...].name
  settings            = each.value
  private_endpoints   = try(each.value.private_endpoints, {})

  # Dependencies (remote objects)
  remote_objects = {
    vnets               = local.combined_objects_networking
    virtual_subnets     = local.combined_objects_virtual_subnets
    private_dns         = local.combined_objects_private_dns
    diagnostics         = local.combined_diagnostics
    resource_groups     = local.combined_objects_resource_groups
  }
}

# Expose outputs
output "cognitive_services_account" {
  value = module.cognitive_services_account
}

docs.title: locals.combined_objects.tf
docs.text:
combined_objects_cognitive_services_accounts = merge(
  tomap({ (local.client_config.landingzone_key) = module.cognitive_services_account }),
  lookup(var.remote_objects, "cognitive_services_account", {}),
  lookup(var.data_sources, "cognitive_services_account", {})
)

This pattern enables: - Local deployments: Resources in current landing zone - Remote deployments: Resources from other landing zones - Data sources: Reference to existing resources

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Modules implement Azure resources following: - CAF naming conventions - Standard variable patterns - Diagnostics integration - Private endpoint support - Cross-module dependencies

docs.title: Standard Module Structure
docs.text:
Every module MUST follow this structure:

modules/category/service_name/
├── providers.tf              # MANDATORY - Provider requirements
├── variables.tf              # MANDATORY - Standard variables
├── outputs.tf                # MANDATORY - Resource outputs
├── locals.tf                 # MANDATORY - Standard locals pattern
├── azurecaf_name.tf          # MANDATORY (if named resource)
├── service_name.tf           # MANDATORY - Main resource definition
├── diagnostics.tf            # MANDATORY (if service supports it)
├── private_endpoints.tf      # MANDATORY (if service supports it)
└── subresource/              # OPTIONAL - Submodules if needed
    ├── providers.tf
    ├── variables.tf
    ├── outputs.tf
    ├── locals.tf
    ├── azurecaf_name.tf
    └── subresource.tf

docs.title: 1. providers.tf
docs.text:
terraform {
  required_providers {
    azurerm = {
      source = "hashicorp/azurerm"
      version = "~> 4.0"
    }
    azurecaf = {
      source = "aztfmod/azurecaf"
      version = "~> 2.0"
    }
  }
}

docs.title: 2. variables.tf
docs.text:
variable "global_settings" {
  description = "Global settings for naming conventions and tags"
  type        = any
}

variable "client_config" {
  description = "Client configuration for Azure authentication"
  type        = any
}

variable "location" {
  description = "Azure location where the resource will be created"
  type        = string
}

variable "settings" {
  description = "Configuration settings for the resource"
  type        = any
}

variable "resource_group" {
  description = "Resource group object"
  type        = any
}

variable "base_tags" {
  description = "Flag to determine if tags should be inherited"
  type        = bool
}

variable "remote_objects" {
  description = "Remote objects for cross-module dependencies"
  type        = any
}

docs.title: 3. locals.tf (MANDATORY Standard Pattern)
docs.text:
locals {
  module_tag = {
    "module" = basename(abspath(path.module))
  }

  tags = var.base_tags ? merge(
    var.global_settings.tags,
    try(var.resource_group.tags, null),
    local.module_tag,
    try(var.settings.tags, null)
  ) : merge(
    local.module_tag,
    try(var.settings.tags, null)
  )

  location            = coalesce(var.location, var.resource_group.location)
  resource_group_name = coalesce(var.resource_group_name, var.resource_group.name)
}

docs.title: 4. azurecaf_name.tf (for named resources)
docs.text:
resource "azurecaf_name" "cognitive_account" {
  name          = var.settings.name
  resource_type = "azurerm_cognitive_account"
  prefixes      = var.global_settings.prefixes
  suffixes      = var.global_settings.suffixes
  use_slug      = var.global_settings.use_slug
  clean_input   = true
  separator     = "-"
}

docs.title: 5. service_name.tf (main resource)
docs.text:
resource "azurerm_cognitive_account" "account" {
  name                = azurecaf_name.cognitive_account.result
  resource_group_name = local.resource_group_name
  location            = local.location
  kind                = var.settings.kind
  sku_name            = var.settings.sku_name

  # All attributes with try() pattern
  custom_subdomain_name           = try(var.settings.custom_subdomain_name, null)
  dynamic_throttling_enabled      = try(var.settings.dynamic_throttling_enabled, null)
  fqdns                           = try(var.settings.fqdns, null)
  local_auth_enabled              = try(var.settings.local_auth_enabled, true)
  outbound_network_access_restricted = try(var.settings.outbound_network_access_restricted, null)
  public_network_access_enabled   = try(var.settings.public_network_access_enabled, true)

  # Dynamic blocks
  dynamic "identity" {
    for_each = try(var.settings.identity, null) == null ? [] : [var.settings.identity]
    content {
      type         = identity.value.type
      identity_ids = try(identity.value.identity_ids, null)
    }
  }

  tags = merge(local.tags, try(var.settings.tags, null))
}

docs.title: 6. diagnostics.tf (MANDATORY if service supports it)
docs.text:
module "diagnostics" {
  source            = "../../diagnostics"
  for_each          = try(var.settings.diagnostic_profiles, {})
  resource_id       = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.id
  resource_location = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.location
  diagnostics       = var.remote_objects.diagnostics
  profiles          = try(var.settings.diagnostic_profiles, {})
}

docs.title: 7. private_endpoints.tf (MANDATORY if service supports it)
docs.text:
module "private_endpoint" {
  source   = "../networking/private_endpoint"
  for_each = var.private_endpoints

  resource_id         = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.id
  name                = each.value.name
  location            = local.location
  resource_group_name = local.resource_group_name
  subnet_id           = can(each.value.subnet_id) || can(each.value.virtual_subnet_key) ? ... : ...
  settings            = each.value
  global_settings     = var.global_settings
  tags                = local.tags
  base_tags           = var.base_tags
  private_dns         = var.private_dns
  client_config       = var.client_config
}

docs.title: 8. outputs.tf
docs.text:
output "id" {
  value       = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.id
  description = "The ID of the Cognitive Services account"
}

output "name" {
  value       = azurecaf_name.cognitive_account.result
  description = "The name of the Cognitive Services account"
}

output "endpoint" {
  value       = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.endpoint
  description = "The endpoint of the Cognitive Services account"
}

output "primary_access_key" {
  value       = azurerm_cognitive_account.account.primary_access_key
  sensitive   = true
  description = "The primary access key"
}

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: Examples serve dual purposes: 1. Documentation: Show how to use modules 2. Automated Tests: Validate modules work correctly

docs.title: Example Structure
docs.text:
examples/cognitive_services/cognitive_services_account/
├── 100-simple-cognitive-account/
│   └── configuration.tfvars       # Basic, minimal config
├── 200-cognitive-private-endpoint/
│   └── configuration.tfvars       # With networking
└── 300-cognitive-advanced/
    └── configuration.tfvars       # All features

docs.title: Naming Convention
docs.text:
• 100-1XX: Simple/basic examples (minimal required configuration)
  • 200-2XX: Intermediate examples (networking, private endpoints, managed identities)
  • 300-3XX: Advanced examples (all features, complex configurations)
  • 400-4XX: Integration examples (multiple services working together)

docs.title: Example Pattern
docs.text:
# File: 100-simple-cognitive-account/configuration.tfvars

global_settings = {
  default_region = "region1"
  regions = {
    region1 = "westeurope"
  }
  random_length = 5
}

resource_groups = {
  cognitive_rg = {
    name = "cognitive-services-test"  # No "rg-" prefix!
  }
}

cognitive_services = {
  cognitive_services_account = {
    account1 = {
      name = "openai-test-1"
      resource_group = {
        key = "cognitive_rg"
      }
      kind     = "OpenAI"
      sku_name = "S0"

      identity = {
        type = "SystemAssigned"
      }

      tags = {
        environment = "dev"
        purpose     = "example"
      }
    }
  }
}

Key Points: - ❌ DON'T include resource type prefixes (e.g., "rg-", "st", "kv-") - ✅ DO use key-based references (resource_group = { key = "cognitive_rg" }) - ✅ DO include global_settings with random_length - ✅ DO use configuration.tfvars as filename

docs.title: The Remote Objects Pattern
docs.text:
The framework uses remote_objects to pass dependencies between modules without tight coupling.

# In aggregator (root level)
module "cognitive_services_account" {
  source = "./modules/cognitive_services/cognitive_services_account"

  remote_objects = {
    vnets           = local.combined_objects_networking
    virtual_subnets = local.combined_objects_virtual_subnets
    private_dns     = local.combined_objects_private_dns
    diagnostics     = local.combined_diagnostics
  }
}

docs.title: The Coalesce Pattern
docs.text:
Modules resolve dependencies using the coalesce pattern with three fallback options:

# In module resource definition
resource_id = coalesce(
  # Option 1: Direct ID (for testing/simple deployments)
  try(var.settings.direct_resource_id, null),

  # Option 2: Current module reference (most common)
  try(var.remote_objects.resource_name.id, null),

  # Option 3: Cross-landing-zone reference (enterprise)
  try(var.remote_objects.resources[
    try(var.settings.resource_reference.lz_key, var.client_config.landingzone_key)
  ][var.settings.resource_reference.key].id, null)
)

Example: Private Endpoint Subnet Resolution

subnet_id = can(each.value.subnet_id) || can(each.value.virtual_subnet_key) ? 
  try(
    each.value.subnet_id,
    var.virtual_subnets[try(each.value.lz_key, var.client_config.landingzone_key)][each.value.virtual_subnet_key].id
  ) : 
  var.vnets[try(each.value.lz_key, var.client_config.landingzone_key)][each.value.vnet_key].subnets[each.value.subnet_key].id

This supports: 1. Direct subnet ID: subnet_id = "/subscriptions/.../subnets/subnet1" 2. Virtual subnet key: virtual_subnet_key = "subnet1" 3. VNet + subnet key: vnet_key = "vnet1", subnet_key = "subnet1"

docs.title: Azurecaf Provider
docs.text:
The framework uses the azurecaf provider to automatically handle Azure naming requirements:

resource "azurecaf_name" "storage_account" {
  name          = var.settings.name
  resource_type = "azurerm_storage_account"
  prefixes      = var.global_settings.prefixes
  suffixes      = var.global_settings.suffixes
  use_slug      = var.global_settings.use_slug
  clean_input   = true
  separator     = "-"
}

# Input: name = "mystorageaccount"
# Output: st-mystorageaccount-xxxxx
# - Adds "st" prefix for storage accounts
# - Adds random suffix (xxxxx) for uniqueness
# - Validates length constraints
# - Ensures only allowed characters

docs.title: Resource Type Mapping
docs.text:
Common resource types and their prefixes:

Azure Resource azurecaf Type Auto Prefix Resource Group azurerm_resource_group rg- Storage Account azurerm_storage_account st Key Vault azurerm_key_vault kv- Virtual Network azurerm_virtual_network vnet- Subnet azurerm_subnet snet- NSG azurerm_network_security_group nsg- AKS azurerm_kubernetes_cluster aks- Cognitive Services azurerm_cognitive_account cog- Grafana azurerm_dashboard_grafana grafana-

[See complete mapping in azurecaf provider documentation]

docs.title: Diagnostics Integration Architecture
docs.text:
All modules that support Azure diagnostic settings MUST include diagnostics integration:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│          Service Module                     │
│  (e.g., cognitive_services_account)        │
│                                             │
│  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐      │
│  │ diagnostics.tf                   │      │
│  │                                  │      │
│  │ module "diagnostics" {           │      │
│  │   source = "../../diagnostics"   │      │
│  │   for_each = var.diagnostic_...  │      │
│  │   resource_id = ...              │      │
│  │   diagnostics = var.remote_...   │      │
│  │ }                                │      │
│  └──────────────────────────────────┘      │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│      Diagnostics Module                     │
│  (modules/diagnostics/)                     │
│                                             │
│  - Log Analytics Workspace                  │
│  - Storage Account                          │
│  - Event Hub                                │
│                                             │
│  Creates diagnostic settings automatically  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Configuration Pattern
docs.text:
# In tfvars
cognitive_services = {
  cognitive_services_account = {
    account1 = {
      name = "openai-test-1"
      # ... other settings ...

      diagnostic_profiles = {
        operation = {
          name             = "operational_logs"
          definition_key   = "cognitive_services_account"
          destination_type = "log_analytics"
          destination_key  = "central_logs"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

This sends all diagnostic logs to the specified Log Analytics workspace automatically.

docs.title: Private Endpoint Integration Architecture
docs.text:
Services that support private endpoints use the networking/private_endpoint submodule pattern:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│          Service Module                     │
│  (e.g., cognitive_services_account)        │
│                                             │
│  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐      │
│  │ private_endpoints.tf             │      │
│  │                                  │      │
│  │ module "private_endpoint" {      │      │
│  │   source = "../networking/...    │      │
│  │   for_each = var.private_...     │      │
│  │   resource_id = ...              │      │
│  │   subnet_id = ...                │      │
│  │ }                                │      │
│  └──────────────────────────────────┘      │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│    Private Endpoint Submodule               │
│  (modules/networking/private_endpoint/)    │
│                                             │
│  - Creates azurerm_private_endpoint         │
│  - Integrates with Private DNS              │
│  - Manages network policies                 │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Configuration Pattern
docs.text:
# In tfvars
cognitive_services = {
  cognitive_services_account = {
    account1 = {
      name = "openai-test-1"
      # ... other settings ...

      private_endpoints = {
        pe1 = {
          name       = "cognitive-pe"
          vnet_key   = "hub_vnet"
          subnet_key = "private_endpoints"

          private_dns_zone = {
            key = "cognitive_privatelink"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Important: The service module NEVER creates azurerm_private_endpoint directly. It always uses the networking/private_endpoint submodule.

docs.title: Simple Deployment (Single Landing Zone)
docs.text:
# Just reference resources by key
resource_group = {
  key = "my_rg"
}

docs.title: Complex Deployment (Cross-Module References)
docs.text:
# Reference resources from other modules
vnet_key   = "hub_vnet"
subnet_key = "private_endpoints"

docs.title: Enterprise Deployment (Cross-Landing-Zone)
docs.text:
# Reference resources from other landing zones
resource_group = {
  lz_key = "shared_services"
  key    = "network_rg"
}

All three patterns use the same coalesce resolution - no code changes required!

docs.title: CI/CD Integration
docs.text:
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│      .github/workflows/                     │
│  - standalone-scenarios.json                │
│  - standalone-compute.json                  │
│  - standalone-networking.json               │
│  - pr_tests-*.yaml                          │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│      Terraform Test Framework               │
│  - Mock providers                           │
│  - Validation only (no real Azure)          │
│  - Fast execution                           │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│      Examples (Layer 3)                     │
│  - Serve as test cases                      │
│  - Validate module syntax                   │
│  - Check variable references                │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: 1. Convention Over Configuration
docs.text:
• Standard file names (providers.tf, not main.tf)
  • Standard variable names (global_settings, client_config, settings)
  • Standard locals pattern (module_tag, tags, location, resource_group_name)

docs.title: 2. Explicit Over Implicit
docs.text:
# ❌ Implicit - unclear fallback
enabled = var.settings.enabled

# ✅ Explicit - clear default
enabled = try(var.settings.enabled, true)

docs.title: 3. Flexibility Through Standards
docs.text:
• Coalesce pattern supports simple to complex deployments
  • Remote objects enable cross-module dependencies
  • Standard structure makes codebase navigable

docs.title: 4. Examples as Documentation
docs.text:
• Working code is better than written instructions
  • Examples serve as automated tests
  • Always demonstrate realistic use cases

docs.title: 5. Backward Compatibility
docs.text:
# Support both new and old attribute names
enabled_attribute = try(
  var.settings.enabled_attribute,  # New name
  var.settings.attribute_enabled,  # Old name (backward compatibility)
  true                              # Default
)

docs.title: Module Lifecycle
docs.text:
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  1. Define Module (Layer 2)                 │
│  - Create standard files                    │
│  - Validate attributes with MCP Terraform   │
│  - Implement diagnostics/private endpoints  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  2. Integrate with Root (Layer 1)           │
│  - Create aggregator file                   │
│  - Add to variables.tf                      │
│  - Add to locals.tf                         │
│  - Add to locals.combined_objects.tf        │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  3. Create Examples (Layer 3)               │
│  - 100-simple (basic config)                │
│  - 200-intermediate (networking)            │
│  - 300-advanced (all features)              │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  4. Add to CI/CD                            │
│  - Add example to workflow JSON             │
│  - Validate path matches directory          │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘
                     ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  5. Test and Document                       │
│  - Test locally with terraform test         │
│  - Update module README.md                  │
│  - Commit and create PR                     │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
The terraform-azurerm-caf framework architecture provides:

✅ Clear Separation of Concerns - 3 layers with distinct responsibilities ✅ Scalability - From simple to enterprise deployments ✅ Maintainability - Standard patterns across all modules ✅ Testability - Examples as automated tests ✅ Flexibility - Multiple ways to reference resources ✅ Consistency - CAF naming and tagging conventions ✅ Integration - Built-in diagnostics and private endpoints

Next Steps: - Module Development Guide - Create new modules - Design Patterns - Deep dive into implementation patterns - Contributing - Contribution guidelines

Last Updated: 2024 Architecture Version: 3-Layer Terraform: >= 1.9
